page.title: 11RADIOACTIVE WASTE DISPOSAL
page.content: NIREX: This body (Nuclear Industries Radioactive-wastes Executive) is responsible for the safe disposal of radioactive waste. "Radioactivity can greatly benifit man. If we want to continue to make progress in this field places to store waste must be found. These wastes are not dangerous when disposed of with care. Due to radioactive decay they gradually become harmless. Existing sites at Drigg in Cumbria will be full by the year 2000 so alternative sites must be found. Elstow site was found to be suitable ....it is sited on Oxford clay which acts as an extra barrier to radiation.There is still a possibility that the will be found unsuitable."
